name: Count Forward to 5
description: Recite the count sequence from 0 to 5 while tracking objects or movements.

name: Match Objects to Counts within 5
description: Pair each object with one number word to ensure one-to-one correspondence up to five.

name: State Cardinality within 5
description: State how many objects are in a set up to five without recounting.

name: Subitize within 5
description: Recognize quantities up to five without counting using dot patterns and five frames.

name: Count Forward to 10
description: Count objects and movements using the number sequence through ten.

name: Count Backward within 10
description: Count backward from any number within ten using the count sequence and visual supports.

name: Count Scattered Sets to 10
description: Count irregular arrangements of objects up to ten with accuracy.

name: Subitize within 10
description: Recognize structured quantities up to ten using ten frames and dice patterns.

name: Write Numerals to 10
description: Read, write, and match numerals to quantities within ten.

name: Match Sets up to 10
description: Compare two sets up to ten by matching objects one-to-one.

name: Compare Quantities up to 10
description: Count and compare two sets to decide which has more, less, or the same number of objects.

name: Compare Numerals up to 10
description: Use symbols and number lines to compare two numerals within ten.

name: Find One More within 10
description: Find the next number by adding one to a given quantity within ten.

name: Find One Less within 10
description: Identify the previous number by removing one from quantities within ten.

name: Successor and Predecessor within 10
description: Determine missing numbers before or after a given number within ten.

name: Join Story Problems within 5
description: Model addition situations within five using objects or drawings.

name: Separate Story Problems within 5
description: Act out subtraction situations within five with counters and visuals.

name: Write Equations for Stories within 5
description: Translate join and separate stories within five into addition or subtraction equations.

name: Count Forward from Any Number to 20
description: Begin at numbers other than one and continue counting to twenty.

name: Count Backward within 20
description: Count backward from any number within twenty using number lines and bead chains.

name: Count Objects within 20
description: Count pictures, objects, and ten-frame representations of quantities up to twenty.

name: Count Structured Sets within 30
description: Count rows, columns, and ten-frame groupings to determine totals through thirty.

name: Skip Count by Tens to 100
description: Skip count by tens using concrete bundles and hundred charts.

name: Extend Number Sequences to 20
description: Complete increasing sequences to twenty using context and patterns.

name: Build Teen Numbers with Ten Frames
description: Compose teen numbers as ten and some more ones using ten frames and beads.

name: Represent Teen Numbers with Cards
description: Use place-value cards to show ten and ones for numbers eleven through nineteen.

name: Decompose Teen Numbers with Equations
description: Write equations to express teen numbers as ten plus remaining ones.

name: Read and Write Numerals to 20
description: Identify and write numerals through twenty from verbal prompts and models.

name: Match Number Words, Models, and Numerals to 20
description: Link number words, numerals, and concrete models for quantities up to twenty.

name: Show Numbers on Ten Frames to 20
description: Use one and two ten frames to build and decompose numbers to twenty.

name: Compare Models to 20
description: Compare quantities to twenty using manipulatives, number lines, and drawings.

name: Compare Numerals with Symbols to 20
description: Use <, >, and = symbols to compare numerals up to twenty.

name: Order Three Numbers to 20
description: Arrange sets of up to three numbers within twenty in ascending or descending order.

name: Find Ten Partners within 20
description: Identify pairs of numbers that make ten using manipulatives and visuals.

name: Compose Teens with Ten and Ones
description: Build teen numbers as ten plus remaining ones using place-value tools.

name: Decompose Within 20 Using Equations
description: Write and solve equations that break apart numbers within twenty into addends.

name: Take Away within 10 Using Objects
description: Remove objects from a set to model subtraction within ten.

name: Compare Sets to Subtract within 10
description: Interpret subtraction as a comparison between two sets within ten.

name: Solve Subtraction Equations within 10
description: Solve for the result or missing part in subtraction equations within ten.

name: Build Two-Digit Numbers with Models
description: Use base-ten materials to compose two-digit numbers as tens and ones.

name: Write Tens and Ones Equations
description: Express two-digit numbers as tens plus ones using equations and words.

name: Regroup Tens and Ones
description: Exchange ten ones for a ten and reverse the process within two-digit numbers.

name: Find Ten More within 120
description: Identify the number that is ten more using hundreds charts and mental strategies.

name: Find Ten Less within 120
description: Determine numbers ten less using vertical moves on the hundred chart and base-ten models.

name: Solve Ten More/Ten Less Word Problems
description: Apply ten-more and ten-less reasoning to real-world and story contexts.

name: Write Numbers in Expanded Form to 120
description: Break two- and three-digit numbers into sums of hundreds, tens, and ones.

name: Convert Expanded Form to Standard Form
description: Combine expanded expressions back into standard numerals up to 120.

name: Explain Expanded Form Representations
description: Describe why expanded forms and models represent the same number.

name: Find Hundred Chart Neighbors
description: Identify numbers directly above, below, before, and after on a hundred chart.

name: Make Jumps on the Hundred Chart
description: Move by tens, fives, and twos on the hundred chart to land on target numbers.

name: Read and Write Numerals to 120
description: Read, write, and sequence numerals up to 120 using hundred charts and place-value cards.

name: Analyze Hundred Chart Patterns
description: Identify diagonal, row, and column patterns and explain their place-value connections.

name: Compare Numbers to 120
description: Use place value and number charts to compare and order numbers up to 120.

name: Count Within 120
description: Count forward and backward within 120 using hundred charts, objects, and number lines.

name: Skip Count by Twos
description: Skip count forward and backward by twos using objects and number lines.

name: Skip Count by Fives
description: Skip count by fives starting at zero and other benchmarks using visuals.

name: Skip Count by 2s, 5s, and 10s
description: Switch between skip-count intervals and explain the resulting patterns.

name: Add Two-Digit Numbers without Regrouping
description: Add two-digit numbers where tens and ones sums stay within their place values.

name: Add Two-Digit Numbers with Regrouping
description: Add two-digit numbers that require exchanging ten ones for a ten.

name: Add Three Two-Digit Numbers
description: Use place-value strategies to add three two-digit numbers efficiently.

name: Build Thousands with Base-Ten Models
description: Assemble hundreds into thousands using base-ten blocks and Montessori bead material.

name: Exchange Hundreds and Thousands
description: Regroup hundreds for thousands and thousands back to hundreds in multi-step contexts.

name: Explain Ten-Times Place Relationships
description: Describe how one place is ten times the value of the place to its right using models and equations.

name: Represent Thousands in Multiple Forms
description: Show the same four-digit number using models, words, and expanded notation.

name: Read Four-Digit Numbers
description: Read numbers to 9,999 using place-value language and standard form.

name: Write Four-Digit Numbers from Words
description: Record numerals when given word, unit, or expanded descriptions.

name: Write Four-Digit Numbers in Expanded Form
description: Represent four-digit numbers as sums of thousands, hundreds, tens, and ones.

name: Locate Benchmarks on the Thousand Chart
description: Find multiples of ten and hundred between 0 and 1,000 on extended charts.

name: Skip Count by Hundreds and Tens on the Thousand Chart
description: Perform large jumps by hundreds and tens to reach target numbers on a thousand chart.

name: Analyze Thousand Chart Patterns
description: Explain diagonal and rectangular patterns on the thousand chart related to place value.

name: Place Benchmarks on Open Number Lines
description: Locate tens and hundreds benchmarks on open number lines up to 1,000.

name: Estimate Midpoints between Benchmarks
description: Approximate values halfway or between benchmarks on number lines.

name: Estimate Sums and Differences on Number Lines
description: Use rounded benchmarks on number lines to estimate sums and differences.

name: Identify Place Values in Three-Digit Numbers
description: Explain the value of each digit in numbers up to 999.

name: Write Three-Digit Numbers from Models
description: Translate base-ten models into numerals and words through 999.

name: Explain Three-Digit Place Value
description: Articulate how hundreds, tens, and ones combine to form a three-digit number.

name: Compare Three-Digit Numbers with Models
description: Use base-ten models to determine which of two numbers is greater or less.

name: Compare Three-Digit Numbers with Symbols
description: Use >, <, and = to compare numerals up to 1,000.

name: Order Multi-Digit Numbers to 1,000
description: Arrange three or more numbers to 1,000 in ascending or descending order.

name: Round Numbers to the Nearest Ten
description: Round two- and three-digit numbers to the nearest multiple of ten.

name: Round Numbers to the Nearest Hundred
description: Round three-digit numbers to the nearest hundred using benchmark reasoning.

name: Justify Rounding on Number Lines
description: Explain rounding decisions using open number lines and benchmark comparisons.

name: Bundle Tens to Make Hundreds
description: Combine groups of ten into hundreds using concrete and pictorial models.

name: Exchange Hundreds, Tens, and Ones
description: Regroup across place values to prepare for multi-digit addition and subtraction.

name: Decompose Hundreds in Multi-Step Contexts
description: Break apart hundreds flexibly to solve complex place-value problems.

name: Interpret Zero as a Placeholder
description: Explain the role of zero in numbers such as 304 or 40 using base-ten models and equations.

name: Solve Place-Value Context Problems
description: Apply place-value reasoning to interpret and solve story problems.

name: Explain Place-Value Strategies
description: Describe why strategies based on place value work for solving problems.

name: Solve Multi-Step Place-Value Contexts
description: Tackle two-step problems requiring comparisons, differences, or compositions using place value.

name: Add Three-Digit Numbers with Regrouping
description: Add multi-digit numbers using place-value strategies and regrouping in ones and tens.

name: Add Several Three-Digit Numbers
description: Add two or more three-digit numbers choosing efficient groupings.

name: Explain Addition Strategies within 1,000
description: Justify regrouping and decomposition strategies when adding three-digit numbers.

name: Subtract Three-Digit Numbers with Regrouping
description: Subtract within 1,000 using place-value decomposition with regrouping in ones and tens.

name: Regroup Across Multiple Places in Subtraction
description: Perform multi-step regrouping across hundreds, tens, and ones when subtracting.

name: Solve Subtraction Word Problems within 1,000
description: Model and solve story problems involving subtraction of multi-digit numbers.

name: Locate Multiples of Ten on Number Lines
description: Place benchmark multiples of ten on open and labeled number lines.

name: Locate Numbers between Tens on Number Lines
description: Estimate positions of numbers between benchmark tens on number lines to 1,000.

name: Place Benchmarks up to 1,000
description: Mark and label key benchmarks such as quarters and midpoints between hundreds on number lines.

name: Estimate Sums by Rounding First
description: Round addends to friendly numbers before adding to estimate sums.

name: Estimate Differences with Number Line Jumps
description: Use open number line jumps and rounding to estimate differences.

name: Choose Efficient Estimation Strategies
description: Select the best estimation approach for addition or subtraction situations.

name: Identify Rounding Benchmarks on Number Lines
description: Mark the nearest tens or hundreds to use as rounding anchors.

name: Explain Rounding Choices on Number Lines
description: Use benchmark proximity to explain why a number rounds to its nearest ten or hundred.

name: Apply Rounding to Solve Word Problems
description: Use rounding on number lines to evaluate reasonableness in story contexts.

name: Skip Count by Tens and Hundreds on Number Lines
description: Make repeated jumps of ten and one hundred on large number lines.

name: Skip Count by Fives on Number Lines
description: Use number line intervals of five to build multiplication readiness.

name: Analyze Skip-Counting Patterns on Number Lines
description: Describe patterns formed by repeated jumps and relate them to multiplication.

name: Model Tenths with Base-Ten Representations
description: Represent tenths using decimal grids, bead frames, and number lines.

name: Model Hundredths
description: Use grids, base-ten blocks, and money models to represent hundredths.

name: Compose Decimals from Tenths and Hundredths
description: Combine tenths and hundredths models to create decimals between 0 and 2.

name: Read Decimals to Hundredths
description: Read decimals aloud using place-value language through hundredths.

name: Write Decimals in Word Form
description: Record decimals from verbal descriptions and models in standard and word forms.

name: Write Decimals in Expanded Form
description: Express decimals as sums of ones, tenths, and hundredths.

name: Read and Write Decimals to Thousandths
description: Read, write, and model decimals to the thousandths place using place-value charts and number lines.

name: Compare Decimals with Models
description: Use area models and number lines to compare decimals to hundredths.

name: Compare Decimals Using Place Value
description: Compare decimals by analyzing highest place values and aligning digits.

name: Order Decimals on Number Lines
description: Sequence decimals to hundredths and place them accurately on number lines.

name: Convert Tenths Fractions to Decimals
description: Write fractions with denominators of ten as equivalent decimals.

name: Convert Hundredths Fractions to Decimals
description: Express hundredths as decimals and decimals as fractions in simplest form.

name: Explain Fraction-Decimal Equivalence
description: Justify why a fraction and decimal name the same value using models and reasoning.

name: Convert Centimeters and Meters
description: Convert between centimeters and meters using place-value reasoning.

name: Convert Millimeters and Centimeters
description: Use base-ten structure to move between millimeters and centimeters.

name: Solve Metric Scaling Problems
description: Apply decimal place-value knowledge to scale metric measurements in word problems.
